item.title: Report E-2025010069
item.description:
Report E-2025010069

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-03
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 3, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was forked and released approximately 55-gallons to the dodck floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched crews from First Call Environmental (FCE) and Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. R+L deployed absorbents prior to their arrival. FCE utilized hand tools to collect the absorbents. All UN1210 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 85-gallon drum, one (1) 55-gallon drum, and four (4) 95-gallon overpacks. TLE personnel aided in transferring all non-damaged product to new, undamaged pallets for continued shipment.

item.title: Report E-2025010038
item.description:
Report E-2025010038

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately three (3) cups of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the lid of the drum lifting up and leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010036
item.description:
Report E-2025010036

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T00:58:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-17
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a packaging defect that resulted in the drum leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. One (1) 85-gallon poly drum was used to containerize the 55-gallon drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
